history.content: Yes, a D is fine if youre overall is >2.0. F's are not.
You would need to repeat a course if you got a failing grade. A D is considered passing, but you need to make sure that your GPA/tech GPA is >2.0.

This is completely due to my own poor planning, but there is the possibility that I may get a D in my technical elective class. For the record, I am a declared CS student in L&S. Is it okay for me to get a D (or D+/-) if my GPA in upper div CS classes/technical electives is above a 2.0?

If I got an F in this technical elective instead of a D or higher, would I definitely have to retake it if I wanted it to count toward my CS graduation?

EDIT: By "is it okay", I mean can I graduate without retaking the class that I got a D (or F) in?
history.subject: OK to get D/F in technical elective?
